title: The Blues Scale
description: Learn the blues scale and its signature 'blue note' that gives blues music its distinctive sound.

steps.title: The Blue Note
steps.description: The blues scale is a minor pentatonic scale with one extra note added: the 'blue note' (a diminished 5th / augmented 4th). This note creates the characteristic tension and expressiveness of blues music. In A blues: A, C, D, Eb, E, G.

steps.title: Play A Blues Scale
steps.description: Play the A blues scale: A, C, D, Eb, E, G. Listen for the tension when you hit Eb (the blue note) and how it resolves up to E.
steps.hint: A (69), C (72), D (74), Eb (75), E (76), G (79). Eb is the black key between D and E.

steps.title: Feel the Blue Note
steps.description: Play D and Eb together. This dissonant half-step is the heart of the blues sound.
steps.hint: D5 (74) and Eb5 (75) are right next to each other.

steps.title: Play C Blues Scale
steps.description: Now try the C blues scale: C, Eb, F, Gb, G, Bb.
